title: Paronychia
summary: Paronychia is an inflammation of the skin around the nail, which can occur suddenly, when it is usually due to the bacteria Staph. aureus, or gradually when it is commonly caused by Candida albicans.[2][3][4] The term is from Greek: παρωνυχία from para, "around", onyx, "nail" and the abstract noun suffix -ia.[5][6]
